title: Faster d3.geo.path implementation.
body:
Rather than creating separate arrays for each geometry, a shared buffer is used
and the array is only converted to a string once.

title: Add padding to d3.layout.pack.
body:
The previous method of subtracting slightly from the radius introduces
distortion where smaller circles are disproportionately reduced. For example,
subtracting 1px from the radius scales a circle of radius 5px by 0.64x, while a
circle of radius 50px is only reduced by 0.96x.

By incorporating padding into the layout algorithm, the leaf circles’ area is
still proportional to the associated value. Due to the scale-independent nature
of the layout, the specified padding value is only approximate.

title: Don't transition label positioning attributes.
body:
The axis component no longer uses a transition for the text elements' dy and
text-anchor attributes. This makes it easier to style the labels using post-
selection, since the transition will not override custom attribute values.

title: Fix bug with unexpected transition inheritance.
body:
Prior to this change, transitions used transition.each internally, which had the
unexpected side-effect of enabling transitions on d3.transition(selection) when
called from within a tween function. This would only occur on the first
invocation of the tween function when the elapsed time between the transition
creation and the transition start was greater than the transition delay;
however, this is fairly common as the default delay for transitions is zero.

This bug caused unexpected behavior if you tried to redraw an axis within a
custom tween function: in some cases, the synchronous redraw of the axis would
compete with a concurrent transition, causing unexpected behavior. By avoiding
the use of transition.each internally, the user now controls when automatic
transitions are enabled.

title: initial implementation of chernoff faces
body:
Chernoff faces as announced a while ago on the mailing list. Examples at http://bl.ocks.org/2011590 and http://www.larsko.org/v/hpi/

I've put it under d3.svg for now as that seemed to be the least inappropriate -- certainly happy to move it somewhere else. Rudimentary documentation at the top of the file.

title: Fix for Issue #675
body: Remove spurious whitespace from class name list before splitting to eliminate null strings, which generate an error from classed(value, false).

title: Force alpha tweaks
body: Allow tweaking alpha decay rate and threshold.

title: d3.time.format.iso.parse returns null for invalid date
body: See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1353684/detecting-an-invalid-date-date-instance-in-javascript

title: Don't use document.createElementNS() unless there's a namespace URI
body: I know that pre-SVG browser support isn't high on your priority list, but having to shim `document.createElementNS()` seems like overkill for getting plain ol' HTML DOM manipulation working in browsers that will never support a namespace other than HTML. So here's a commit that only uses `createElementNS()` if there's a namespace URI, otherwise `createElement()`.

title: Always display powers-of-ten tick labels.
body:
Previously, the log scale's tick format would hide all labels when there was not
enough room to display the requested number of ticks; now it at least displays
the power-of-ten labels. Fixes #655.

title: API inconsistency when using Sizzle causing defect in IE9
body: When using Sizzle, the API for `d3_select` changes when there is no element to select. When using Sizzle, `undefined` is returned since `[][0] === undefined`. Without Sizzle, `d3_select` returns `null`. This is a problem, because IE9 does not support calling `HTMLElement.insertBefore` (see selection-insert.js) with `undefined` as the second argument; `null` is fine, though.

title: Fix race condition in transition tests.
body: The transition-test-text callback was failing to fire when using the latest Node.js master (joyent/node@82bcdbb8aaa4cf58917dc8d3fd4fcfc272512a2c).  This was most likely due to these tests being run in a different order due to a different object enumeration order.

title: passing object into .attr()
body:
normally, the .attr() function forces coders to have quite long strings of .attr(key,value) snippets. It would look like: 
  d3.select('#svg').append('circle').attr('r',50).attr('fill','#fff').attr('stroke','#f00');
Changing the function a little bit, it can operate more like the jQuery .css() function. Coders can pass an object of `key : value` pairs that will be looped through and called as a single .attr() command. the new code looks like 
  d3.select('#svg').append('circle').attr({
    "r" : 20,
    "fill" : "red",
    "stroke" : "#fff",
  });

title: add start and end parent != undefined in d3_layout_bundlePath while
body:
An undefined import causes a fatal error in the bundle-radial demo.  This commit avoids the error, the ui will go on to draw a line to a blank node.  To recreate initial undefined error add a un-"name"ed node to one of the imports in examples/data/flare-imports.

Thanks for sharing such an awesome tool.

title: Fix dangling globals in d3.layout.{hierarchy,pie}.
body: Also add missing semicolon to mercator example.

title: "Bundle" interpolation for single-element arrays.
body:
Probably a better fix than #640.

In future we may want to generate some kind of loop, but it's not clear what orientation such a loop should have, so perhaps a "non-line" like this is better as a default.

title: Add support for self-loops to d3.layout.bundle.
body: Self-loops were being bundled as a single-element array, causing issues when used with d3.svg.line.  They are now bundled as a two-element array.  Although this results in a "non-line" when used with "bundle" interpolation, other interpolators could potentially generate a loop using the two-element array.

title: Add nest.mapValues as an alias for rollup.
making force.start() just a wee bit more readable.
body:
No functional change, but making the force.js code that wee bit more readable for a human; it's nice to rely on the intricate combination of parent scopes and function call order there, and it permits one to reduce the number of function parameters if that's a goal, but it makes for a tougher 'read' of what is happening here exactly, at least for me.

(re-issue of pull request which was done based on merged code just a few minutes ago; github didn't see the branch as something different from my 'master' branch thanks to merge instead of rebase/cherrypick)

title: force.js sourcecode readability improvement
body: No functional change, but making the force.js code that wee bit more readable for a human; it's nice to rely on the intricate combination of parent scopes and function call order there, and it permits one to reduce the number of function parameters if that's a goal, but it makes for a tougher 'read' of what is happening here exactly, at least for me.

title: Fix size comparison for circle packing layout.
Fix d3.xhr for local URIs.
body:
It turns out there's a simple way to support almost all local `file://` requests (where req.status is always 0 in current browsers). The only case where this doesn't work is when the file does actually exist but is empty.

I've tested the CORS use case in Chrome and Safari, and local xhr now works in Safari (it won't work in Chrome at the moment unless you relax the strict security settings).

title: Chordratio & new chord SVG
body: I've added the chordratio layout which takes a rectangular array of relationships between entities. Each row represents an entity, each column is that entity's contribution to some total value for the column. I also changed the svg chord to a cubic spline in an attempt to reduce path self-intersections.

title: Add browserify compatibility
body:
Hi,

These 3 little lines make d3 compatible with [browserify](https://github.com/substack/node-browserify) and thus allow developers like me to easily include d3 – or any browserify-compatible module requiring d3 (like cubism.. :D) – in their browserify bundles. Great !

Please merge if OK !

title: Bootstrap d3 build without need for pre-compiled d3.v2.js and package.json
body:
Noticing d3 used Make to build and before seeing the wiki-page @ https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki, I stumbled through building it using Make and figuring out npm (forgive me, I've not tried nodejs yet!).  

 $ make clean
 $ make

That didn't work (and I figured out why)...   Ultimately, I think I uncovered a couple subtle things that made bootstraping the build harder than it needed to be IMHO.

These are minor issues...but I think nice-to-have.

As a mater of taste, I don't like the idea of having build artifacts in version control...so before trying to build d3 I removed them (with `make clean`) which prompted the suggestions below:
### made `make package.json` depends on `src/core/core.js`, not pre-compiled `d3.v2.js`

Currently `npm install` depends on -> `node src/package.js` depends on -> `index.js` which depends on -> `d3.vs.js`.  `index.js` requires the dependencies `vows` and `jsdom`.  So, to install the d3 dependencies I need to run `src/package.js` which depends on the same dependencies...  A dead end...

So, I changed `src/package.js` to require the file with version number (the only thing it needs) instead of full `d3.vs.js` which also removes the `jsdom` and `sizzle` deps in `src/package.js`.
### renamed `make install` to `make prepare`

Given it's behavior (AFAICT, it is a helper to install the nodejs dependencies needed for d3 from a compiled package.json specifying the dependencies), it made more sense to name it something else.  In make conventions, `make install` is to install the compiled software onto the system, in this case, we are simply preparing the system for a build.
### `make prepare` depends on package.json

I explicitly specified this dependency in the Makefile.  It seems this make target is perhaps neglected (I don't see it's predecessor `make install` anywhere in the WIKI)... but given that I know nothing about `npm`, using make for all steps of bootstrapping a build environment has appeal to me.
## Install From Source

Ultimately, after these changes, on a clean machine with only make and node, and no pre-existing build artifacts, the build becomes:

``` bash
$ # Prereqs: gnu make and nodejs
make prepare
make 
make test
```

compared to before:

``` bash
npm install
make
make test
```

Slightly cleaner and now works in more cases.
#### Disclaimer

This was way more explanation than necessary, but I am trying to get the hang of markdown, github, and pull-requests, forgive me.

All the best!

cheers,
eric

title: Fix another rounding bug with SI-format.
Fix d3.svg.brush for IE9.
body:
The problem with the old fix was the use of g.select(".background") instead of g.selectAll(".background").  This caused the background rect to get the parent's datum, overriding the initial datum of 0.  The brush mouse handler checks the datum of the event target: a truthy datum means a resize action.

We didn't see this problem in the brush examples because the brush parent elements didn't use data binding.

I've also reverted to using pointer-events: none|null for the fix as this seems more appropriate than display: none|null.
